call_history.title: Morning Blood Pressure Meds
call_history.summary: Maitri took her meds and confirmed she had a glass of water.

transcript.text: Good morning, Maitri! It’s a beautiful day. Are you ready for your blood pressure tablet?
Oh, hello dear. Let me see... I have the strip here, but where did I put my glasses?
Take your time. I'll wait right here. Check the side table near your lamp.
Ah, found them! Okay, I have the Lisinopril. One tablet, right?
That's correct. Just one. Go ahead and take it with a full sip of water. Let me know when you've swallowed it.
Done. Thank you for the reminder, I almost forgot today.
You're very welcome, Maitri. Have a wonderful morning!

call_history.title: Sleep Meditation
call_history.summary: Full guided breathing session completed. User reported feeling 'lighter'.

transcript.text: The day is over, Maitri. It's time to let go of any worries. Shall we start our breathing?
Yes, please. My mind has been racing about the grocery list for tomorrow.
We can handle the list tomorrow. For now, close your eyes. Breathe in for four seconds... hold... and breathe out slowly.
That feels much better. My shoulders were so tight.
Visualize a calm lake at sunset. You are safe and supported. Your son is just a call away if you need anything.
I feel much lighter now. Thank you. Goodnight.
Goodnight, Maitri. Sleep peacefully.

call_history.title: Diabetes Check
call_history.summary: Glucose was 110 mg/dL. User confirmed feeling physically well.

transcript.text: Hi Maitri! Just checking in for your evening glucose reading. Do you have your monitor ready?
Wait a second... it's just calibrating. Okay, here we go. It says one hundred and ten.
110 is exactly where we want it to be. Great job! How are you feeling physically? Any dizziness or fatigue?
No, I feel quite steady today. I had a good dinner.
That’s wonderful to hear. You can proceed with your evening insulin dose as planned. I'll log this for your doctor.

call_history.title: Social Call: Son
call_history.summary: User did not answer after 45 seconds of ringing. Snooze logic initiated.

transcript.text: [System Note: Outbound call ringing...]
Hi Maitri, your son is hoping to chat... [No response recorded]
I'll try you again in 15 minutes. Talk soon!

call_history.title: Lunch Vitamin
call_history.summary: User was eating; AI rescheduled for 20 minutes later.

transcript.text: Hi Maitri, it’s lunchtime! Don't forget your multivitamin.
Oh! You caught me right in the middle of my dal and rice. Can I take it after I finish?
Of course! It's actually better to take it on a full stomach. Shall I call you back in 20 minutes to check?
Yes, please do that. That would be perfect.
Understood. Enjoy your meal, Maitri. I'll speak to you shortly.

call_history.title: Morning Stretching
call_history.summary: Guided shoulder and neck exercises. User reported slight stiffness.

transcript.text: Ready to get moving, Maitri? Let's start with some gentle shoulder rolls.
I'm ready, but my left side is a bit stiff today. It rained last night.
The damp weather can definitely do that. Let's be very gentle. Just lift your shoulders to your ears and roll them back slowly. One... two... three.
Oh, that's a bit tight... but it feels good to move.
Perfect. Now, let’s slowly tilt your head toward your right shoulder. Stop if you feel any sharp pain.
I'm doing it. Much better. My neck was locked up.
Excellent work. Movement is medicine! We're all done for now.

call_history.title: Morning Meds
call_history.summary: User proactive; confirmed taking meds before the call started.

transcript.text: Good morning, Maitri! Time for your morning—
[Interrupting] I already swallowed them, dear! I beat you to it this morning.
[Laughs] You’re ahead of the curve today! Did you manage to have some breakfast with them?
Yes, I had my tea and toast just ten minutes ago.
Wonderful. I'll log that as completed. Keep up that great energy!

call_history.title: Anxiety Support
call_history.summary: User called AI due to shortness of breath; AI guided through grounding exercise.

transcript.text: Help... I'm feeling a bit panicked. My chest is feeling very tight and I can't catch my breath.
I'm right here with you, Maitri. You are safe. I want you to focus only on the sound of my voice. Can you tell me three things you see in the room right now?
I see... my blue vase... the television... and a picture of my son.
Good. Focus on the blue of that vase. Now, let's take a slow breath through your nose. In... one, two, three. And out through your mouth... one, two, three.
Okay... I think the tightness is easing. I was just worried about the doctor's appointment tomorrow.
It’s natural to feel nervous, but you are prepared. I'll stay on the line until your heart rate feels normal again.

call_history.title: Social Bridge: Son
call_history.summary: AI acted as a bridge for a family conference call.

transcript.text: Maitri, your son is on the line and wants to say hello. Connecting you now.
Hello? Beta? Can you hear me?
[System Note: AI monitoring for safety in background... conversation continues between family members]
Thank you, VoiceCare, that was a lovely chat.
My pleasure, Maitri. It’s always good to hear his voice. I’ll close the line now.

call_history.title: Morning Meds
call_history.summary: User slurred speech detected. System triggered automatic caregiver alert.

transcript.text: Good morning, Maitri. Time for your medicine. How are you feeling?
I... I don't feel... every... everything is a bit... blurry... dear...
Maitri, listen to me. I've detected that you aren't feeling well. I am calling your son and the local nurse right now. Do not get up from your chair.
I... I tried to walk... but...
Please stay seated, Maitri. I am keeping this line open. Your son is being notified that you are feeling dizzy. Help is on the way.
